title: How to Draw a Scorpion

steps.headline: Draw a large horizontal (but slightly diagonal) oval at the center of the paper.
Draw a line inside the oval, near where you would like the head (in this case, the lower part of the oval).
Add a pair of small fortune cookie-shaped ovals in front of the line.
steps.description: These will serve as the scorpions claws.

steps.headline: Add stretched ovals to connect the claws to the body.
Draw three circles on both sides of the scorpion.
steps.description: For the circles facing you, attach another stretched circle each.

steps.headline: Line three ovals behind the scorpion.
steps.description: This will serve as its tail.

steps.headline: Draw the scorpion's big cartoony eyes.
Start tracing the outline of this scorpion.
Add details.
Erase unnecessary lines.
Color the drawing as desired.
Draw a small diagonal oval near the center of the paper.
From the center of that oval, draw a large curved line resembling a hook.
steps.description: Add another small oval at the tip of that "hook."

steps.headline: Back at the main oval, draw two small ovals--one on each side of the main one.
Make another curved line (shaped like the letter C) and draw it in a way that it passes through the lined-up ovals.
At both tips of this new line, draw a small oval each.
By now you have a line skeleton of the body, tail and claws of the scorpion.
steps.description: On its body, add four pairs of zigzag lines for its legs. Again, add an oval on each of their tips.

steps.headline: Start tracing the outline of this scorpion.
Add details.
Erase unnecessary lines.
Color the drawing as desired.

tyn: Colored pencils, crayons, markers or watercolors
